name: cherimoya
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a fruit with rough green skin, soft white flesh, and large black seeds that grows especially in Central America, or the small tree that produces this fruit. It is a kind of custard apple: He grew mangoes and cherimoyas for the Southern California market. Also known as "custard apple" because of its creamy texture, cherimoya is most often eaten raw. The cherimoya grows in the form of a small tree, usually about 15 or 20 feet high. We had a delicious chirimoya sorbet, served outside in the sun.

More examplesFewer examplesThe cherimoya is my favourite fruit. The flavour is somewhere between a passionfruit and a pear.The cherimoya is ripe when it is soft to touch and the outside turns a darker colour. The cherimoya is subtropical, growing in tropical countries only at considerable elevations, where the climate is cool.
